page.title: 02Glasgow Royal Infirmary
page.content: A very large hospital composed of two buildings-one opened in l9l5 and the other in l982-serving Glasgow's East end.A new maternity wing is planned for the future. Specialisations include Nuclear, Cardiac, Renal and Orthopaedic medcine, as well as general medicine and surgery.They are opening a bone marrow transplant unit and hope to start heart transplants.Their Accident and Emergency Unit is one of the busiest in Western Europe. The hospital has 52 wards with 918 beds.It employs 400 doctors, 2000 nurses, 1000 ancilliary staff and costs Â£32 million p.a. to run. Their most unusual case was an outbreak of Legionnaire's Disease in which three people died, including a nurse and a doctor.
